intro: Hieracium laxicollum, commonly known as the loose-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium laxicollum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
